description: Canadian Finance Minister Chrystia Freeland denied that there’s growing friction between her office and that of Prime Minister Justin Trudeau.
title: Canada’s Finance Minister Rejects Claim She’s In Conflict With Trudeau

description: Ken Griffin and Paul Singer, Republican billionaires who have criticized Donald Trump, met with the former president to discuss donating to his White House bid, according to people familiar with the discussions.
title: Griffin, Singer Met with Trump About Funding White House Bid

description: Billionaire Elon Musk has donated to a super political action committee working to elect Donald Trump to the White House, a major gambit by the world’s richest person to make his imprint on the US political landscape.
title: Musk Donates to Trump, Tapping Vast Fortune to Swing 2024 Race

description: Donald Trump hasn’t yet revealed his running mate — but his campaign is already planning to introduce the vice presidential candidate to oil-industry donors at an Oklahoma City fundraiser this month, according to people familiar with the matter.
title: Oklahoma Fundraiser, Other Events Planned for Trump’s VP Pick

description: President Joe Biden sought to reassure voters of his fitness for office amid growing calls from fellow Democrats to drop his bid for a second term.
title: Biden Tells Voters ‘I’m OK’ in Bid to Rescue Troubled Campaign

description: President Joe Biden’s press conference on Thursday, when he directly addressed questions about his mental acuity, drew an audience of at least 25.1 million viewers — a big turnout for what’s usually a less-newsworthy event.
title: Biden Press Conference Has Audience of 25.1 Million Viewers

description: Pakistan reached a new $7 billion loan deal with International Monetary Fund, offering some breathing room for new Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif’s government to shore up its faltering economy and manage its mounting debts.
title: Pakistan Reaches New $7 Billion Loan Deal With IMF

description: A Southern California congressman directly challenged Joe Biden to end his reelection campaign during a virtual meeting the president held Friday with a group of Democratic lawmakers.
title: House Democrat Confronts Biden on Call, Seeks His Withdrawal

description: This is Washington Edition, the newsletter about money, power and politics in the nation’s capital. Every Friday White House correspondent Akayla Gardner delivers a roundup of the key news and events in politics, policy and economics that you need to know.  Sign up here and follow us at @bpolitics. Email our editors here.
title: Democrats Aren’t Just Worried About Biden’s Reelection

description: Rudolph Giuliani’s personal bankruptcy case was thrown out by a federal judge following nearly seven months of stalled progress, leaving the former New York City mayor without court protection from creditors owed more than $150 million.
title: Giuliani’s Bankruptcy Dismissed With $150 Million Still Owed

description: Argentina recorded the first monthly pick-up in inflation of the year, marking a slight reversal of the downward streak President Javier Milei put in motion with his aggressive economic shock therapy.
title: Argentina Inflation Snaps Milei’s Five-Month Slowdown Streak

description: Cal Poly Humboldt President Tom Jackson Jr. announced he will step down after a tumultuous semester that saw pro-Palestinian protests escalate into building occupations, arrests and a campus-wide shutdown.
title: Cal Poly Humboldt President Exits After Pro-Palestinian Protests

description: NATO’s European members have long thought they would prefer an ailing Joe Biden to an unpredictable Donald Trump. But now they’re coming to terms with the fact that — whoever wins the election — US priorities are increasingly going to shift elsewhere.
title: Whether It’s Biden or Trump, Europe Knows It Must Stand Alone

description: Donald Trump likened the upcoming announcement of his vice presidential pick to his onetime reality show The Apprentice, saying he was still weighing as many as five potential contenders with just days until the start of the Republican National Convention.
title: Trump Invokes ‘The Apprentice’ as Rollout of Running Mate Looms

description: Carson Block is certain that markets need short sellers “more than ever.” The problem: a relentless stock rally and fresh regulatory challenges are weighing on his bearish peers struggling to raise capital.
title: Carson Block Says Wall Street Needs Short Sellers More Than Ever

description: Rivals for centuries, China and Russia now have a de facto alliance, even if it’s failed to reach the high “no limits” bar that Presidents Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin set just weeks before Russia’s invasion of Ukraine in February 2022. The economic, military and political ties nurtured over the past decade between the world’s two most powerful authoritarian states — both of which aim to upend at least parts of the US-dominated post-Cold War order — have grown as a result of the war, despite Ch
title: Why Are Putin and Xi ‘Best Friends’?

description: President Joe Biden is forging ahead with a political war on two fronts: against skeptics from his own party and against Republican challenger Donald Trump.
title: Biden Opens Two-Front Fight in Bid to Save 2024 Reelection Bid

description: The UK’s new government said it will release low-risk prisoners after they’ve served 40% of their sentences — compared with 50% currently — as part of a bid to address an overcrowding crisis in the country’s jails.
title: UK to Release Prisoners Earlier to Tackle Overcrowding Crisis

description: The odds of a September interest-rate cut by the Federal Reserve are tempered by the threat of an inflationary policy shock after the US election, according to Mohamed El-Erian.
title: El-Erian Says US Politics Threaten Chances of September Fed Cut

description: The European Union is accelerating plans to improve ties with Turkey aimed at strengthening trade relations next year even as Ankara is increasingly looking toward rival multilateral groups after becoming frustrated with a lack of progress with Brussels.
title: EU Aims to Revive Turkey Ties as Ankara Looks to Its Rivals

description: Nepal’s prime minister Pushpa Kamal Dahal will step down after losing a vote of confidence in the country’s parliament.
title: Nepal’s Prime Minister Loses Parliament Trust Vote, To Step Down

description: Donald Trump hasn’t always had kind words to say about Milwaukee, reportedly calling it “a horrible city” in a meeting last month with Republicans.
title: Milwaukee Is Getting Ready for Trump’s Visit to ‘Horrible City’

description: President Javier Milei is tapping the brakes on his shock therapy program in a bid to hold on to popular support amid Argentina’s bleak economic reality, even if it means unsettling markets.
title: Milei Dials Back Shock Therapy to Keep Argentina’s Inflation in Check

description: Germany is planning to order more than 100 Boxer self-propelled howitzers from Franco-German defense contractor KNDS, the latest big-ticket purchase as part of a major military expansion by the ruling coalition.
title: Germany Plans to Order More Than 100 Wheeled Howitzers from KNDS

description: Finland’s parliament voted in favor of a law that allows the Nordic country to push back migrants that Russia sends to its border as part of Moscow’s hybrid warfare.
title: Finland Passes New Law to Stop Migrants at Russia Border

description: This summer, Kyiv will finally get the F-16 fighter jets it’s been insisting it needs to repel Russia — but in far fewer numbers than it had hoped.
title: Ukraine’s F-16 Ambitions Snarled by Language Barrier, Runways and Parts

description: An alliance in several Spanish regions between the country’s main conservative party and a far-right group collapsed after a stand-off about the treatment of undocumented underage immigrants.
title: Spain’s Far Right, Conservatives End Alliance After Disagreement on Immigration

description: Polish Prime Minister Donald Tusk’s government failed to pass legislation decriminalizing abortion in a tight vote, laying bare divisions within the ruling coalition on an issue that’s polarized the nation.
title: Polish Coalition Fails in Key Effort to Decriminalize Abortion

description: China is sanctioning six American defense companies and senior executives for their involvement in a recent US arms sale to Taiwan, according to the Chinese Ministry of Foreign Affairs.
title: China Sanctions Six US Defense Companies for Taiwan Arms Sale

description: Russia said it will suspend harvesting of seaweed by Japanese fisherman around the area of a decades-long territorial dispute from next week while a lighthouse undergoes maintenance.
title: Russia to Halt Japanese Seaweed Harvesting Near Kuril Islands

description: Budapest’s liberal mayor secured a second term in office after a court-mandated recount confirmed his victory over a rival endorsed by Prime Minister Viktor Orban.
title: Budapest Mayor Wins, Foiling Orban’s Effort to Seize Capital

description: At a time of hyper-polarized politics, even the wonky mechanics of US bond auctions are fair game — and that’s making Treasury Secretary Janet Yellen a new favorite target of some Trump-leaning Republicans.
title: Yellen Grilled by Trump Allies in Odd Feud Over Debt Management

description: Zambia’s proposed regulations that could impose 10-year jail terms for using foreign currency in local transactions have raised questions and criticism from local businesses, in what could be a crucial test of President Hakainde Hichilema’s pro-investment government.
title: Zambia Dedollarization Drive Is Key Test for Pro-Business Leader

description: Elon Musk’s social media platform X has been hit with a warning from the European Union for deceiving users into engaging with potentially harmful content, in the latest show of force by Brussels against Big Tech’s practices.
title: Musk’s X Slammed by EU for Its Deceptive ‘Blue Check’ Assurances on Harmful Content

description: Welcome to Balance of Power, bringing you the latest in global politics. If you haven’t yet, sign up here.
title: The War Between Israel and Hamas in Gaza Is Far From Over

description: President has won plaudits for his developmental transformation of Rwanda, but it’s come at the cost of political suppression. Now a man who’s never won less than 93% of the vote looks to extend his 30 years in power at the election on July 15
title: Rwanda’s Besieged Opposition Lives in the Shadow of Paul Kagame

description: Donald Trump crushed Marco Rubio’s White House aspirations in 2016, besting “Little Marco” in a vicious contest notable for crude insults and arguments over who was more dependent on makeup and tanning beds.
title: How Rubio Went From ‘Little Marco’ to Trump VP Contender

description: China will break its tradition for holding a monthly press conference to answer questions on economic data, as President Xi Jinping convenes Communist Party officials for a policy meeting in Beijing.
title: China to Skip Quarterly GDP Briefing as Xi Holds Party Conclave

description: Russian imports from China began to recover in June despite difficulties with foreign trade payments triggered by the US’s threat of secondary sanctions and restrictions on Moscow’s main exchange.
title: Russian Imports From China Tick Up Again After Putin-Xi Meeting

description: The left-wing parties that banded together to win the biggest number of seats in France’s snap election are struggling to unite to come up with a candidate for prime minister.
title: French Left Struggles to Unite to Solve Prime Minister Puzzle

description: A Pakistan top court has decided to hand two dozen seats from this year’s elections to Prime Minister Shehbaz Sharif’s rivals, undermining the government’s ability to pass through reforms.
title: Imran Khan Gets Relief from Pakistan Court for Parliament Seats

description: President Recep Tayyip Erdogan urged German Chancellor Olaf Scholz to lift a block on the sale of Eurofighter Typhoon jets to Turkey, shortly after scaling back a $23 billion contract for F-16s with the US.
title: Erdogan Urges Germany to End Ban on Eurofighter Jet Sales to Turkey

description: Hungarian Prime Minister Viktor Orban traveled to Florida to meet Donald Trump in the latest stop on his self-styled “peace mission” on Ukraine that has angered Western allies.
title: Orban Meets Trump After Riling Allies With Moscow, China Visits

description: Legislative gridlock means that Macron’s pro-investment reforms will likely stay in place.
title: French Elections Result Is Least Worst Outcome for Business

description: The UK’s Labour Party was propelled to a landslide victory in last week’s general election by voters with mortgages, a new study shows, suggesting a desire for change among homeowners who are facing higher borrowing costs.
title: UK Mortgage Holders Helped Labour to Landslide Win, Study Shows

description: In May, Kenyan President William Ruto was dining at the White House, the first African leader to be treated to a state dinner in a decade and a half — a measure of his stature as one of the continent’s most preeminent leaders.
title: High-Flying Kenyan President Brought Down to Earth by Protests

description: Japan replaced the head of its navy and punished more than 200 defense officials after a string of scandals that include mishandling of classified information and overclaiming on pay.
title: Japan Replaces Navy Chief, Punishes Officials Over Scandals

description: Galaxy Digital LP founder Mike Novogratz and filmmaker Andrew Jarecki are two donors behind a $2 million contribution to Democrats who have called for President Joe Biden step down as the party’s nominee, the latest sign donors are shifting money away from the presidential ticket.
title: Novogratz Boosts Biden Critics as Donors Boycott President

description: Japan has serious concerns about North Korea’s developments in ballistic missiles as Kim Jong Un rolls out a new array of nuclear-capable weapons to attack his neighbors, according to the annual defense white paper.
title: Japan Defense Paper Shows Concern for North Korea’s Missile Advancements

description: A court in Taiwan ordered a former vice premier detained while he is investigated for corruption, the latest development in the highest-profile graft probe in the democratically run archipelago since President Chen Shui-bian in 2008.
title: Taiwan Detains Former Vice Premier Facing Corruption Inquiry

description: President Joe Biden said European allies are prepared to cut investment to China if it keeps up its support for Russia, offering a warning after NATO accused Beijing of enabling the invasion of Ukraine.
title: Biden Says Allies to Cut China Investment Over Russia Policy

description: Two Russian-born Australian citizens, one of whom is a member of the Australian Army, have been arrested and charged with espionage, authorities said on Friday.
title: Australia Says Army Private Charged With Spying for Russia
